Employment Application (STD.678): It is a requirement to submit work experience, dates, and hours worked, contact names and phone numbers of supervisors on the state application in order of current and old work experience. Resumes or other documents cannot substitute a state application. Applicants who fail to submit a completed STD.678 may not be considered.

We offer competitive pay, advancement opportunities, upward mobility, work-life-balance, and for many positions, flexible hours and remote work options. The State of California offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package, subject to eligibility, such as: Pension through CALPERS, Medical Benefits, including health, dental, and vision insurance, Medical benefits into retirement, Deferred Compensation options: 401k and 457b, Leave benefit options (Vacation/Sick or Annual Leave), Paid Holidays, Group Legal Services, Life Insurance, ScholarShare (College Saving Account), Pre-Tax Parking, Commute Program, School Loan forgiveness under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program
Job_Description: This is a continuance of previous advertisement originally posted on 11/17/2023. Previous applicants remain under consideration and do not need to reapply. This position is located in the city of Santa Barbara.

Application Packages may be submitted electronically through your CalCareer Account at www.CalCareers.ca.gov. When submitting your application in hard copy, a completed copy of the Application Package listing must be included. If you choose to not apply electronically, a hard copy application package may be submitted through an alternative method listed below: Address for Mailing Application Packages Department of Rehabilitation Attn: Human Resources - JC 403882 721 Capitol Mall Sacramento, CA 95814 Address for Drop-Off Application Packages Department of Rehabilitation 721 Capitol Mall Sacramento, CA 95814 08:00 AM - 05:00 PM

Job_Description: Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with a dynamic team of safety professionals committed to ensuring California workplaces are safe? Are you eager for change and passionate about making a tangible difference? State Fund’s Safety and Health unit is looking for a dynamic safety professional to join our team in providing occupational safety inspection and consultation services to our policyholders. This position will provide safety services to policyholders with more complex and difficult risk conditions to reduce employee injury. If you’re ready to hit the ground running in this field-based position, we want you on our team.
Application_Instructions: Completed applications and all required documents must be received or postmarked by the Final Filing Date in order to be considered. Dates printed on Mobile Bar Codes, such as the Quick Response (QR) Codes available at the USPS, are not considered Postmark dates for the purpose of determining timely filing of an application.
Eligibility: Individuals who are currently in the classification, eligible for lateral transfer, eligible for reinstatement, have list eligibility, are in the process of obtaining list eligibility, or have SROA and/or Surplus eligibility (please attach your letter, if available). SROA and Surplus candidates are given priority; therefore, individuals with other eligibility may be considered in the event no SROA or Surplus candidates apply. Applications will be screened and only the most qualified applicants will be selected to move forward in the selection process.
Additional_Documents: Job Application Package Checklist, Duty Statement
Desirable_Qualifications: • Two or more years' experience as a safety engineer or safety consultant in construction, electrical, or industrial sector OR three (3) years of professional construction, electrical, or industrial engineering. • A degree in Engineering or field directly related to Occupational Safety & Health (Additional qualifying experience may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis). • Expertise in construction safety. • Proficiency in assessing workplace injury/illness risks and implementing safety improvements. • Adept at interpreting workplace safety regulations regarding workers compensation and occupational safety and health. • Exceptional analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and mechanical relationships effectively. • Proficient at public presentations, training employees, and employers. • Self-motivated and work with minimal direct supervision - Team player. • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to craft clear and concise reports using various software tools. • Ability to document services effectively, using non-technical terms and vocabulary that • Bi-lingual in Spanish is an asset.

Job_Description: Under the direction of the Institution Quality Management/Patient Safety (QM/PS) Health Program Manager III, the Health Program Specialist (HPS) I is a highly skilled, technical subject matter expert supporting the local QM/PS Programs and is a member of the institution Quality Management Support Unit (QMSU). Either I One year of experience in the California state service performing duties equivalent to Associate Health Program Adviser. (Applicants who have completed six months of service performing the duties as specified above will be admitted to the examination, but they must satisfactorily complete one year of this experience before they can be eligible for appointment.) Or II Experience: Three years of progressively responsible experience in health program administration, at least one year of which shall have been with major responsibility for a significant program such as is normally found in a complex or departmentalized medical care delivery setting or health institution or organization. (Possession of a Doctoral Degree in Public Health, Health Administration, Health Planning, Public Administration, or a closely related health professional field may be substituted for up to one year of the required general experience.) and Education: Possession of a Master's Degree in Public Health, Health Administration, Hospital Administration, Comprehensive Health Planning, Public Administration, or a closely related health professional field. (One year of additional specialized qualifying experience may be substituted for the required master's degree.)

Job_Description: Are you an experienced and visionary Information Security professional ready to lead our dynamic security operations team in safeguarding our organization's information assets? Do you thrive in collaborative environments where your expertise directly influences the organization’s security stance? CalPERS seeks an experienced and dynamic Security Operations Manager to lead and oversee our security operations department. The Security Operations Manager will be responsible for creating and implementing security strategies, managing security personnel, and ensuring the effectiveness of our security programs.

Provides engineering support such as failure analysis, design verification, preparation of design and contract drawings, emission upgrades/retrofits, preparation of cost estimates, checking of drawings and construction submissions, field inspections, and other related work. Provides analytical support such as preparation of vehicle usage reports, and equipment allocations.

Title: NURSING CONSULTANT, PROGRAM REVIEW
Application_Methods: Electronic (Using your CalCareer Account), By Mail, Drop-off
Minimum_Requirements: You will find the Minimum Requirements in the Class Specification.
Position_Details: Under the direction of the Statewide Chief Nurse Executive or designee, responsibilities include targeted assistance to Infection Prevention and Control Nurses and Public Health Nurses at assigned institutions. Develops policies, participates in onboarding and training, operationalizes public health and infection prevention and control policies and procedures, and participates in the development and implementation of disease surveillance systems and program evaluation activities.
Special_Requirements: Requires a valid Nursing License. Include a copy of your license prior to being hired. Do not include confidential information like SSN, birthdate, etc., in your application documents. Possession of Minimum Qualifications will be verified before interview/appointment. Foreign degrees must be verified for US equivalency.
Benefits: Benefits information available on the CalHR and CalPERS websites.
Job_Description: Located in Elk Grove, less than 30 minutes from Sacramento, this position offers a hybrid telework schedule. It involves providing program consultation and direction regarding nursing, public health, and infection prevention and control practices, procedures, clinical guidelines, and standards of care. Also involves developing policies and decision support for disease prevention and control programs.
Application_Instructions: Complete Application Packages must be received or postmarked by the Final Filing Date. Application Packages may be submitted electronically or in hard copy. Ensure all experience and education related to the Minimum Qualifications are included in your application.
Eligibility: Individuals with classification eligibility, lateral transfer, reinstatement, list eligibility, SROA, or Surplus eligibility. Training and Development assignments may also be considered.
Additional_Documents: Job Application Package Checklist, Duty Statement
Desirable_Qualifications: Ability to develop and improve public health and infection prevention control processes and procedures, with good judgment and analytical skills to evaluate the effectiveness of these programs.

Title: PSYCHOLOGIST (HEALTH FACILITY - CLINICAL - SAFETY)
Application_Methods: Electronic (Using your CalCareer Account), By Mail, Drop-off
Minimum_Requirements: You will find the Minimum Requirements in the Class Specification.
Position_Details: The role involves providing clinical psychology services within a secure facility. Key responsibilities include psychological assessments, treatment planning, and delivery, with an emphasis on forensic populations. Opportunities for supervision and training of interns and staff are also provided. The position may require involvement in research and other professional activities.
Special_Requirements: A valid license as a psychologist is required. Background checks and drug screenings are part of the hiring process. This position may involve access to vulnerable populations, and therefore a thorough vetting process will be undertaken. Relocation and interview reimbursements are available up to $10,000 depending on operational needs and fund availability.
Benefits: Competitive salaries, Continuing Medical Education reimbursements, generous retirement benefits through CalPERS, comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans, and a collegial working environment. Benefits also include alternate work schedules, professional education leave, and license renewal reimbursements.
Job_Description: This position offers licensed psychologists the opportunity to work in a challenging yet rewarding environment within the state hospital system. It includes direct patient care, diagnostic assessments, and involvement in a variety of therapeutic interventions. The setting provides a unique opportunity to work with complex cases within the forensic population, contributing significantly to public safety and individual rehabilitation.
Application_Instructions: Applicants must submit a complete application package by the filing deadline via electronic or hard copy methods as outlined. It is crucial to include all required documents, specifically highlighting relevant experience and qualifications as per the job announcement. Completed applications are screened, and only the most qualified will proceed to the interview stage.
Eligibility: Open to current state employees, those eligible for reinstatement, or individuals in possession of transfer eligibility. Training and Development assignments may be considered.
Additional_Documents: Current CV, formal letter of interest, transcripts, and graduate diploma are required as part of the application package.
Desirable_Qualifications: Experience in clinical assessments, treatment of severe mental disorders, forensic psychology, and providing expert testimony are desirable. The ability to work effectively within an interdisciplinary team and manage complex cases is also valued.
Job_Benefits: State employees enjoy health benefits, paid holidays, a defined benefit retirement plan, 401(k) and 457 plans, a Commute Program, and an Employee Assistance Program. A variety of other perks are also available, including a work-life balance support.
Reasonable_Accommodation: Reasonable accommodations for the application and interview processes are available upon request. These may include, but are not limited to, accommodations for disabilities.
Equal_Opportunity_Info: The Department of State Hospitals is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to age, ancestry, color, disability (physical or mental), gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation.
Drug_Free_Workplace_Policy: California strives to maintain a drug-free workplace as mandated by state law. Applicants are expected to adhere to these policies and may undergo drug screening procedures as part of the hiring process.

Title: PUBLIC UTILITIES REGULATORY ANALYST IV or III
Application_Methods: Electronic (Using your CalCareer Account), By Mail, Drop-off
Minimum_Requirements: You will find the Minimum Requirements in the Class Specification.
Position_Details: The analyst will participate in proceedings and programs related to communications industry regulation. Responsibilities include conducting technical and policy research, making evidence-based recommendations, writing comments on utility applications and Commission rulings, delivering presentations, testifying at hearings, and representing the Public Advocates Office in various forums. Assigned work may include other utility services as needed.
Special_Requirements: Applicants must prepare and submit responses to specific questions in a Statement of Qualifications (SOQ), not exceeding two pages, detailing experience in policy research, data analysis, and report writing. Refer to the Special Requirements for further instructions. The position also requires travel.
Benefits: Competitive salaries, opportunities for advancement, substantial continuing medical education reimbursement, generous CalPERS retirement benefits, excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits, and a team-oriented, collegial working environment.
Job_Description: The Policy Section in the Communications and Water Policy Branch is seeking a qualified individual for complex regulatory analysis and advocacy. Duties include the development of policy recommendations, participation in proceedings, preparation of reports, and representation at public forums. The role demands strong analytical skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team. Candidates should be adept at managing multiple projects and have a robust understanding of regulatory frameworks.

Desirable_Qualifications: Candidates should have a strong foundation in public policy, excellent analytical, research, and communication skills, and the ability to interpret complex legal and technical information. They should also be capable of handling high-pressure situations and tight deadlines.
Job_Benefits: Health, dental, vision insurance, paid holidays, a defined benefit retirement program, Savings Plus Program (401(k), 457), Commute Program, Employee Wellness Program, and Employee Assistance Program.

Title: RESEARCH DATA SPECIALIST II
Application_Methods: Electronic (Using your CalCareer Account), By Mail, Drop-off
Minimum_Requirements: You will find the Minimum Requirements in the Class Specification.
Position_Details: Under the general direction of the Research Data Manager, the specialist will perform duties involving complex data management tasks, including designing, implementing, and maintaining data collection systems. Responsibilities include analyzing large datasets to support decision-making and developing reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Special_Requirements: Do not include confidential information such as SSN or birthdate in application documents. Background checks and drug screenings required. Official transcripts and verification of U.S. degree equivalency for foreign degrees required prior to appointment. Live Scan Fingerprinting and TB testing required.
Benefits: State employees enjoy comprehensive benefits including health, dental, vision insurance, retirement plans through CalPERS, paid holidays, vacation, and sick leave. Information on additional benefits can be found on the CalHR website.
Job_Description: This position involves working with complex datasets to support the healthcare operations within California's correctional facilities. Duties include data collection, analysis, and reporting to improve healthcare outcomes and efficiencies. The role requires advanced analytical skills, proficiency with various data analysis tools, and the ability to present complex information in an accessible format.
Application_Instructions: Applications must be complete and postmarked by the final filing date. Include all required documents, such as a resume and any certifications or qualifications related to the job. Electronic submissions through CalCareer are preferred. Applications are screened based on qualifications and the most qualified candidates will be invited for interviews.
Eligibility: Open to individuals currently in the classification, eligible for lateral transfer, reinstatement, have list eligibility, or SROA and/or Surplus eligibility. Attach eligibility proof if available.
Additional_Documents: Job Application Package Checklist, Duty Statement
Desirable_Qualifications: Experience with data analysis, statistical methods, and reporting tools. Knowledge of healthcare systems or public health data preferred. Excellent communication and project management skills are essential.
Job_Benefits: Competitive salary, health benefits, retirement plans, and professional development opportunities.
Reasonable_Accommodation: Requests for reasonable accommodations should be made at the time of the interview scheduling. Further inquiries can be directed to the EEO office listed in the job posting.
Equal_Opportunity_Info: The State of California is an equal opportunity employer, offering employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, or veteran status. This commitment includes adhering to a drug-free workplace policy.
Drug_Free_Workplace_Policy: California aims for a drug-free workplace. Applicants must comply with the drug-free policy, and this compliance is critical as it aligns with the state's legal and ethical standards.

Title: RESEARCH DATA SPECIALIST II
Application_Methods: Electronic (Using your CalCareer Account), By Mail, Drop-off
Position_Details: Performs complex data management tasks, analyzes large datasets, supports decision-making, and develops reports.
Special_Requirements: Confidential info excluded. Background check and drug screenings required. Foreign degrees must be verified. Live Scan Fingerprinting and TB testing required. PDF format preferred. E-Verify used.
Benefits: CalHR and CalPERS websites for benefits. On-site gym and childcare. Free parking.
Job_Description: Participates in data capture, development, analysis of healthcare data using statistical methods to inform hospital leaders.
Application_Instructions: Complete applications including STD 678 and all required documents by final filing date. Electronic submissions preferred. Applications screened for most qualified candidates.
Eligibility: Open to those with classification, lateral transfer, reinstatement, list eligibility, or SROA/Surplus eligibility. Proof required.
Desirable_Qualifications: Data management, project management, SQL/Tableau, MS Office skills, familiarity with health care organization operations.
Job_Benefits: Health, dental, vision insurance, retirement plans, professional development opportunities, free parking, gym, and childcare.
Reasonable_Accommodation: Reasonable accommodations provided upon request during the application and interview processes. Inquiries to the EEO office.
Equal_Opportunity_Info: Equal opportunity employer, providing employment without regard to protected characteristics, ensuring a drug-free workplace as mandated by state law.
Drug_Free_Workplace_Policy: Applicants are expected to comply with the drug-free workplace policy in accordance with state law.
